intro: Malapoenna borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related species. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
